alert.note: Alert for Harnett; Johnston; Wake (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 10 at 8:01PM EDT until September 10 at 9:45PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR NORTHEASTERN HARNETT, JOHNSTON AND SOUTHEASTERN WAKE COUNTIES... At 801 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Smithfield, Garner, Fuquay-Varina, Clayton, Dunn, Zebulon, Angier, Benson, Knightdale, Selma, Wendell, Erwin, Coats, Four Oaks, Coats Crossroads, Flowers, Lake Benson and Emit. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
